job_Description: Life at MX  We are driven by our moral imperative to advance mankind - and it all starts with our people, product and purpose. We always carry a deep sense of drive and passion with us. If you thrive in a challenging work environment, surrounded by incredible team members who will help you grow, MX is the right place for you.  Come build with us and be part of an award-winning company that’s helping create meaningful and lasting change in the financial industry. Job Purpose The data science team at MX is focused on solving the company’s most computationally and analytically complex problems using statistical and machine learning methods. The work is challenging, engaging, and directly influences MX’s portfolio of products and services. If you’re passionate about asking good questions and applying modern data science tools in a fast-paced, intellectually engaging environment, you’ll enjoy working at MX as a Senior Data Scientist. As part of MX’s thriving analytic organization, you’ll enjoy autonomy and the ability to make a real difference in a successful and high-growth company. As you collaborate with other creative and enthusiastic team members you’ll be rewarded and recognized for your high-caliber work. MX’s values are central to the company’s success, and you’ll live by questioning assumptions and taking initiative, advancing our data-driven approach to solving problems, and showing empathy and a commitment to radical honesty in equal measure. extra points for work focused on credit risk modelling, customer satisfaction and engagement, and/or product development 5 years of practical experience building a variety of predictive/machine learning/statistical models and tools from complex, specialized, or large data pools Strong knowledge of one or more structured programming languages for statistical and/or numeric computing (e.g., Python, R, or Scala) and database query languages (e.g., SQL); exposure to modern data science environments (e.g., cloud, Jupyter, and git) would also be helpful Expertise with (a) one or more of logistic regression, generalized linear models, or categorical data analysis and (b) multiple machine learning approaches (e.g., k-means clustering, SVM, random forest, or PCA) Critical thinking skills, intellectual curiosity, and a willingness to keep looking for better solutions Drive to tackle demanding goals with enthusiasm, tenacity in the face of stubborn obstacles, and interest in pursuing personal and technical development alongside other commitments Commitment to client needs and satisfaction, humility in the face of constructive feedback, and production of high-quality work that builds trust and confidence with stakeholders Ability to translate strategic mission objectives into an analytical framework, project plan, and action items You’ll fit in by… Collaborating with members of the Sales/Partnerships, Marketing, and Operations teams Embracing the challenge of creating something from nothing and living your passion for mathematical problem solving Being resourceful, creative, and tenacious Communicating with skilled candor and respect You’ll love it because… The data science team is dedicated to solving important and high-impact questions unconstrained by assumptions or approach You will have the opportunity to work in a successful, fast moving, mission-driven company You will access growth opportunities and collaborate with highly motivated, intellectually curious, and genuinely nice colleagues You will be rewarded and recognized for your high-caliber work You will enjoy autonomy #LI-Remote

job_Description: Salt Lake Community College (SLCC) is an emerging Hispanic Serving Institution (HSI) and a premiere community college in the western United States and a national leader. To identify ways to increase completion and achieve equity across student populations, the college has invested in data and analytics and seeks a skilled director to lead the strategic effort. This position is the institutional champion and advocate for building of institutional capacity for evidence-based, data-informed planning and decision-making. This includes leading the development of an institution-wide system for operational and strategic data and information reporting for both front-line personnel and senior leadership. This position, working with the VP and the office of information technology, establishes the data strategy (including the data and tools necessary) that aligns with the operational needs to ensure value, ROI, control, and risk are properly attended to. This position must listen and respond to faculty, staff, and administers to design data products around their needs.  The director will oversee the strategic development of relevant and timely institutional research and reporting to inform executive and departmental decision-making. The director implements sophisticated statistical and data science techniques to better understand and recommend equitable improvements for enrollment, registration, graduation, and transfer processes. The director will lead research and analytics projects seeking ways to raise completion equitably, increase college access to underrepresented populations, improve institutional effectiveness, and support students through successful transfer and meaningful employment. Her research should lead to continued development of standardized reports as appropriate. This position participates in the development of the necessary data infrastructure, tools, platforms, processes, and reports to improve organizational decisions through the strategic use of data and information assets.  This position will also cultivate meaningful primary student success research among faculty, departments, and administrative divisions. As the work described above identifies the needs for further primary research, the director oversees the development of research experiments to test the efficacy of proposed initiatives or projects. Designing experiments based on literature in behavioral economics and other disciplines, the director will oversee the design and execution of both small and large-scale improvement experiments, which, if demonstrated successful, can be taken to scale.  This position also oversees the Institutional Review Board at the college. This position is at-will. Essential Responsibilities and Duties Set office culture and provide leadership, direction, and management for the personnel, resources, and processes of Data Science and Analytics office. Hire, train, and supervise supporting personnel, including scheduling, delegating, coordinating and clarifying work. Ensure budget and other college resources are used effectively.  Direct and coordinate sophisticated data science and analytics efforts to improve decisions and outcomes towards strategic goals and front-line initiatives. Work with the assistant vice president in improving access to meaningful strategic data and information to improve student outcomes.  Supervise the planning and execution of primary student success analytics and research projects, including providing research reports for college leadership.  Provide consultation, training and support in research and data analysis/application to College personnel.  Other duties as assigned. Essential Responsibilities and Duties Continued Preferred Qualifications PhD preferred. Some college-level teaching experience preferred. Bilingual (Spanish preferred). Experience in community college or educational administration. Experience with Banner.  Minimum Qualifications Masters degree in public administration, statistics, business, education, data science, information technology, educational psychology, or other related field. Five (5) years related work experience including two years of management/supervision. Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Leadership and Management: Demonstrated strong and equitable supervisory skills including directing, mentoring and training staff.
